attributes.action: Remove articles 28-35 inclusive in chapter 6 of the offensive weapons bill.
attributes.background: These clauses in the Bill seek to make certain firearms illegal. This is wholly unnecessary with the robust firearms licensing that is implemented in the UK to protect public safety. None of the equipment contained in these clauses have ever been used in a crime on UK soil.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the handgun ban in 1997, lawful firearms shooters at Home Office Approved clubs have not been able to use such items however the career criminals easily procure these items for their illegal activities. 
Further firearms restrictions proposed in this bill are not the prudent way forward in tackling the root causes of crime and will have zero effect on the reduction of violent crime in the UK. The Government need a holistic approach to education, welfare and policing, which in time will yield lower crime statistics nationally. This is where policy should be concentrated.

attributes.action: No cap or limit on compensation for Windrush Generation and their descendants
attributes.background: We want a fair compensation scheme for the Windrush Generation that is in line with compensation awarded by the courts in civil cases. There should be no artificial cap that will inadequately compensate those who have suffered emotionally, financially, lost their homes and citizenship.
attributes.additional_details:
Six months since Windrush Scandal was exposed there has been some progress and numerous apologies from the Prime Minster.The government intend to introduce a cap on all compensation claims despite the fact they did not recognise or consider any interim or hardship fund. The Windrush Generation plus others from the Commonwealth have paid their taxes and contributed to the wealth, prosperity and cultural identity of UK since WW2.The scheme needs to reflect this.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-44888187

attributes.action: Stop the Online Forums Bill 2017-18 becoming law.
attributes.background: Thought control by politicians, backed by the main stream media has led to ever more sinister intrusions into people's freedom to criticize public policy and assemble into campaign groups.
attributes.additional_details:
By requiring platforms to publish information about closed forums and making Administrators responsible for content is Orwellian and anti-democratic.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/onlineforums.html

attributes.action: Allow the British people to vote on cannabis legalisation
attributes.background:
This Government stands on the shoulders of the phrase "will of the people" it should therfore agree, that the only way to settle this long term debate, is to allow a people's vote on cannabis legalisation. 

Join the campaign at Let Us Vote
 on twitter and facebook
attributes.additional_details:
Uk biggest exporter of legal cannabis 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/health-44197038

Cannabis 114× less deadly than Alcohol

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/weed-is-114-times-less-deadly-than-alcohol-study-finds-10066496.html

Violent crime rate reduced in states that legalise cannabis

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/14/legal-marijuana-medical-use-crime-rate-plummets-us-study

attributes.action: Change the law on drink driving to no drink at all while in charge of a vehicle
attributes.background: Stop drinking while driving completely, as in you cannot have any alcohol while in charge of any vehichle! To many people lose there loves one through someone else's irresponsible actions, yet all they get in return of taking a life is a couple years in prison at the most.
attributes.additional_details: We need a tougher punishment for this crime such as longer prison time and harsher license loss, if over the limit if you cause an accident it should be you lose your license for more than 5 years followed by a prison sentence minimum punishment. UK laws are to lax time to make them tougher. Save lives not lose them!!

attributes.action: An independent study to find if driven grouse shooting is of  economic benefit.
attributes.background: Driven grouse shooting is a minority sport which seriously compromises other activities and businesses over vast stretches of northern England. We need to determine if it is driving away more jobs and enterprises than it creates, which is likely - no country outside of the UK has it.
attributes.additional_details: Driven grouse shooting has been implicated in the loss of wildlife and oportunities for wildlife tourism. The uplands it dominates could instead have fully fledged ecotourism, natural flood alleviation projects, be more fire resistant, have woodlot forestry to provide fuel for those without mains gas, provide cleaner water and better fishing and be considerably better for general tourism. https://water.leeds.ac.uk/wp-content/uploads/sites/36/2017/06/EMBER_2-page_exec_summary.pdf

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Invoke the Parliament Act if the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill
attributes.background: Brexit is democratically mandated by the referendum and manifestos of parties in Government. If the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, the Government must prorogue Parliament immediately and work quickly to meet the conditions to use the Parliament Acts so that the Bill can receive Royal Assent.
attributes.additional_details: The Parliament Acts assert the supremacy of the House of Commons over the House of Lords. Section 2 allows the EU (Withdrawal) Bill to be presented for Royal Assent by the Commons provided certain conditions are met. We voted to Leave the EU to restore sovereignty to the British people, for freedom and self-determination. We voted for a clean break. Lets begin this new chapter in our history by honouring the wishes of our people. Facebook.com/Brexiteers

attributes.action: Statutory periodic vision screening for all drivers during their driving life
attributes.background: The UK regulations are amongst the weakest in Europe relying on self-regulation and reporting. Road safety should start with good vision and current procedures lack any medical rigour to substantiate visual fitness to drive increasing the potential for injury or death due to accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
WHO declared poor vision is one of the main risk factors for crashes.

A 2014 Brake study showed 1.5 million UK drivers have never had an eye test.

Visit www.drivingblind.org.uk to rally support.

attributes.action: Off-Payroll: Give full rights to workers classed as ‘employed for tax purposes'
attributes.background: Newly proposed reforms to tax the self-employed – known as Off-Payroll Working - introduces rules that enable firms to classify workers as ‘employed for tax purposes’, without providing them with any employment rights. This is wholly unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
New measures in the Off-Payroll Working consultation effectively introduce a new 15% tax for self-employed workers, while enabling firms to circumvent their obligation to give employment rights to workers. This opposes the intentions of the Government’s ‘Good Work Plan’, designed to prevent unscrupulous firms forcing vulnerable workers into precarious work.
Parliament must ensure self-employed workers cannot be classed as ‘employed for tax purposes’ without receiving full employment rights.

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into South Western Railway under MD Andy Mellors
attributes.background: As a commuter and regular user of South Western Railway I need answers from Westminster as to why privatized companies such as this can get away with such an increasingly appalling service!
attributes.additional_details:
Broken down train at Clapham Jct
on eve of 19/6/18 causing delays of over an hour to most of South East!
General daily failure of trains to leave at published times.

attributes.action: Ban UK tour agents promotion of animal attractions which fail national standards
attributes.background: Currently there is absolutely no legislation which governs the practices of UK tour companies when operating abroad with regards to animal welfare. This means the tour companies are able to sell tickets to animal attractions which would be completely illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The lack of legislation abroad means tour companies have been able to promote and profit from highly controversial animal practices, many of which have been consistently documented to cause extreme animal suffering and are often environmentally unsustainable. 
Notable examples of such exploitation include: selling tickets to see or swim with whales and dolphins, selling opportunities to ride on overworked elephants or camels, selling tickets to meet tigers which are often sedated.

attributes.action: Allow people who make a living from the land to live where they work.
attributes.background: A presumption in planning law that people making a living off the land can live where they work would encourage the creation of rural enterprises and assist with the housing issues for rural workers.  It would therefore promote a thriving rural economy and increase food security.
attributes.additional_details: For more information, see www.bulworthy.uk/petition

attributes.action: Improve outcomes for children with meningitis by auditing national guidelines.
attributes.background: 30% of young babies with bacterial meningitis receive inappropriate pre-hospital management, which results in delays in getting help. An audit of national guidelines is key to improving early diagnosis and survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Meningitis is difficult to spot - 49% of children with the most common type of bacterial meningitis are sent home after a first GP visit. Parents/carers of these children should be given 'safety netting' information about meningitis and sepsis to protect their child.

Parents want consistent information and safety netting reduces GP re-attendance. 

An audit of NICE Guideline CG102 and Quality Standard QS19 will determine if safety netting information is offered and help improve outcomes.

attributes.action: To appoint independent facilitator to engage MLAs in talks and resolve impasse
attributes.background: This petition, from the We Deserve Better movement, demands that the UK Government do everything in its power to get MLAs to solve their outstanding issues and re-establish effective government for all or have their salaries further cut.
attributes.additional_details: As of September 14th Northern Ireland will have been without a government for 606 days. We Deserve Better is not affiliated to any political party it is a campaign by and for the people. It demands that the UK government work with the Irish Government to appoint an independent facilitator to proactively reinvigorate discussions between all parties. If the parties do not agree to actively engage in discussions to solve the outstanding issues with immediate effect and re-establish a legislative body, as a parallel process, we demand that the UK government cut the salaries of MLAs.

attributes.action: Scrap NHS surcharge for non EU living in UK who already pay N.I contributions
attributes.background: It has come to the notice of Association of Africans in Scotland (AAS), a charitable organisation that non EU families who legally live, work&pay taxes/N.I in the UK are asked to cough up an additional NHS surcharge (separate from the HO fees&other costs) when they renew their immigration documents
attributes.additional_details: Telegraph of 5 February 2018, reported Health minister saying: "Our NHS is always there when you need it, paid for by British taxpayers. These people, even though non-EU, pay taxes/NI as well which goes into the NHS. AAS believes in the United Kingdom as a country which champions fairness & subjecting applicants who already pay N.I to pay another mandatory NHS surcharge amounts to double taxation & therefore an unfair practice. AAS is therefore calling for a review and scrapping of this charge.

attributes.action: Get independant panel research into vaccine damage in dogs and review protocol.
attributes.background:
Lepto vaccines are believed to be responsible for the serious illnesse/ death of dogs.
Major et al. (2014) investigated an outbreak of Lepto in Bern Switzerland.  298 dogs found with Lepto. Vaccination history was available for 251 of these dogs (84.2%) Of these 95% were fully vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details:
Distemper, Hepititis and Parvovirus are all conditions which can be tested for, a titre test would be healthier and safer than just routinely repeating the vaccine. 
Dogs can be FULLY VACCINATED AND STILL CONTRACT THESE CONDITIONS due to vaccine failure or high immunity carried by the dam. Therefore just blindly vaccinating does not work. 

We believe an independant panel will take a realistic view of the true dangers of vaccination.

attributes.action: Introduce licenses for Animal Rescue Centres
attributes.background: Rescue Centres and individuals do not currently need a local authority Pet Shop or Boarding Licence if they only receive donations. A lot are never inspected unless reported for horrific welfare conditions, many animals are suffering at the hands of unscrupulous people purely out to make money.

attributes.action: Train Education Workers on School Refusal (condition) & Stop Attendance Fines
attributes.background: Education employees are actioning poor attendance through the penalty system as they don’t see School Refusal as a Mental Health issue. We would like to see staff, trained to recognise & act  accordingly as mental health is not a punishable condition
attributes.additional_details: School Refusal Support Services was set up to help & support families enduring this crisis in their child’s everyday life.Staff are misinterpreting what they see & instead see the child as a truant.Staff need to understand & be trained in the differences, have the skills to support families, recognise the child's needs, work with families to move forward & not apply fines.There is a plethora of feedback from parents to suggest that  un/diagnosed spectrum conditions underpin School Refusal.

attributes.action: Provide funds to reopen main road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley
attributes.background: The main A road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley is closed to traffic after a bridge was deemed structurally unsafe. Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair the bridge. We want central Government to step in and reopen the A422.
attributes.additional_details:
The A422 between Banbury and Brackley is an important access route between local towns, villages, jobs, schools and services, between the M1, A43 and M40. Diverted traffic is using unsuitable single track roads and roads through villages adding time, costs and danger. 

Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair Farthinghoe bridge. We want central Government to step in and provide funds to reopen the A422.

attributes.action: PM to refer ERG funding to the Independent Advisor on Minister's Interests.
attributes.background: The 'European Research Group' (ERG) is a closed political group within the government that has been supported by Ministers through their expense claims. The Prime Minister is called upon to refer this to the Independent Advisor on Minister's Interests (IMAI) for investigation and action.
attributes.additional_details:
The ERG is a closed political lobby group within the government, or in other words a "non-public organisation whose objectives may in any degree conflict with government policy". 
Various (ex)Ministers have supported this group through subscriptions claimed on expenses. This is in breach of the Ministerial Code. It is understood that public funds claimed could be in the order of over £250,000. 
Only the Prime Minister can refer allegations to the IAMI - for investigation and repayment.

attributes.action: Allow existing Ambulance Staff Career progression without being penalised
attributes.background: The new pay deal in the NHS is detrimental to existing Ambulance staff who wish to progress with their career. This pay deal will have the effect of hampering staff development/promotion and this could lead to a skills shortage in the next few years of experienced ambulance personnel.
attributes.additional_details:
The new NHS Pay deal included 7 words which will hamper the development of ambulance staff as any existing member of staff who has a "changes of roles (including promotion)." will be forced to a new way of being paid their unsocial hours allowance which will be detrimental for certain staff and incur the loss of up to £2.5K.

We want existing Ambulance staff to be able to progress in their careers without fear of changes to their terms and conditions and to their unsocial hours pay.

attributes.action: Declare the 2016 referendum on membership of the EU null and void.
attributes.background: Under section 3.3 (e) of the CODE OF GOOD PRACTICE ON REFERENDUMS the UK government should declare the result of the 2016 referendum null and void because of the decision by the Electoral Commission that rules on spending were broken and referral to the police has been made.

attributes.action: Place Cardiac Physiologists on the National Shortage Occupational list.
attributes.background: There is at least a 30% deficit in employed Cardiac Physiologists across the UK currently. Staff who are working in the UK already and those wanting to work in the UK are being rejected via the home office. The UK is struggling to provide safe Cardiology services with this lack of staffing.
attributes.additional_details: There is at least a 30% deficit in employed Cardiac Physiologists across the UK currently. Staff who are working in the UK already- and have done for many years- and those wanting to come to work in the UK are being rejected due to the point system via the home office. This leaves ALL cardiology departments across struggling to provide a safe heart service across the UK. Placing Cardiac Physiologists back on the list will fix this issue immediately. We were removed in 2013, hence the staffing issue.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory prison sentence for vehicle theft.
attributes.background: Vehicle theft is increasing year upon year. The level of violence thieves are using, is also increasing. Thieves are entering residential homes solely to take vehicle keys.  Vulnerable mothers with children are being targeted.
attributes.additional_details:
David Jamieson, police and crime commissioner for the West Midlands: "Car thefts have doubled in two years – that’s an epidemic.

"This is making our lives really difficult. It’s sucking up loads of police time...”

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-england-44893229 

https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/cars/939651/stolen-car-theft-keyless-entry-hack-UK-risk/amp

https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/car-news/consumer-news/100213/uk-car-thefts-soar-by-56-per-cent%3famp

attributes.action: Uphold current Responsible Pharmacist rulings and reject Remote Supervision
attributes.background: The rebalancing board have put forward a proposal named 'Remote Supervision' whereby they want to allow technicians to supervise the sale of pharmacy and prescription only medication and want to allow pharmacists to be signed in as a Responsible Pharmacist for more than one pharmacy at a time.
attributes.additional_details: The remote supervision of pharmacies will mean that pharmacists will be legally responsible for more than one pharmacy at a time and therefore legally responsible for pharmacies which they have no way of effectively supervising. Also, pharmacy technicians will be allowed to hand out pharmacy only and prescription only medications with no input from a qualified Pharmacist. This will be detrimental to patient healthcare. More information can be found on the PDA website.

attributes.action: UK Government to raise the case of  Jonathan Nash with the Qatari Government.
attributes.background: Jonathan Nash has been sentenced to 37 years in a Qatari prison. His crime? Nothing more than a bounced cheque. In line with Qatar’s judiciary system (or lack of) he has not been given the opportunity to defend himself. No day in court and no opportunity to state his case.

attributes.action: To widen the exemptions of the Ivory Bill: de minimis rule to be 50%
attributes.background: I am concerned that the Government are using this topic to try and destroy the bona fide antiques trade. De minimis rule: 50% for cultural objects made of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Following the introduction of the Ivory Bill, the de minimis rule is too narrow at 10% to be a working meaningful exemption. If it is not amended by Parliament it will cause the wilful destruction of genuine antiques: a chest of drawers with ivory inlay, a chess set or even a religious icon like a Corpus Christi, making them illegal to sell and perhaps be even subsequently confiscated or destroyed.

attributes.action: Georgia’s law: Require stay drug safe measures and testing at all festivals
attributes.background: Georgia Jones died at Mutiny festival May 26th 2018 after taking two pills. All festivals should have drug safe measures. Alongside security checks and dogs, there should be clear warning signs of potential side effects. Front of house testing would also give more information to the individuals.
attributes.additional_details: Research has proven that all these measures do help and make people think twice, with half choosing not to take. Searches do not stop drugs getting in. Education and advice is what is needed.

attributes.action: Revise Rule 135 to stop administrators from taking fees out of client assets
attributes.background: On the collapse of a stock-broker, this rule allows administrators to take fees out of client assets / money held in “ring-fenced” accounts. A conflict of interest arises between returning assets to clients in a timely fashion and the administrators' corporate motivation to maximise fee income.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have invested entire life-savings via ISAs and SIPPs under the assumption that their assets / money are ring-fenced and protected.

Revise Rule 135 of the Investment Bank Special Administration Rules (England and Wales) 2011 to preserve the sanctity of ring-fenced accounts and prevent a break-down of the trust in the UK financial system.

The FSCS, which is funded by a levy on financial institutions, must cover any and all costs incurred in returning ‘ring-fenced’ assets to clients.

attributes.action: Serious injury by dangerous driving should carry a minimum of 5 years in prison!
attributes.background: My nephew was an unfortunate casualty of this. He was 2 at the time when a careless, selfish driver thought it is more important to use his phone whilst driving. He ran a red light at knocked out my dad and nephew. The result, my nephew being severely brain damaged and now needed 24 hour care!
attributes.additional_details:
The driver pleaded guilty to the offence and then further found guilty of using his phone. The sentence given - 2 year suspended sentence for each count (2 counts). The boy full of life will never live a normal life, the family will never have their once happy, full of life, playful son! 
The driver has got off with a slap on the wrist and will live a normal life, whereas the boy and his family will live with a life sentence! 
The sentence should change and carry a minimum of 5 years in prison!

attributes.action: Make it possible for any baby to have a birth and death certificate after labour
attributes.background: Having gone through an early labour at 21 weeks and giving birth to a beautiful baby girl, who sadly died seconds after birth, I was heartbroken to realise that her short life would not be recognised legally on this earth with a birth and death certificate. This option should be available to parents
attributes.additional_details:
The current law in England and Wales is that in order to file a birth and death certificate the child must be born after 24 weeks of pregnancy.

The NHS currently offer a hospital-based commemorative certification, however this is not a legal document or proof of life and death. 

No matter the week of pregnancy any parents of a laboured birth should have the option to file for a birth and death certificate.

attributes.action: Prevent the downgrade of services to County Hospital, Louth in Lincolnshire.
attributes.background:
Lincolnshire East CCG is proposing to cut beds at Louth Hospital from 50 to either 20 or 16 beds. Other services have also been withdrawn in recent years.
We ask the Secretary of State for Health to increase funding for Louth Hospital to maintain the services in East Lindsey.
attributes.additional_details: Louth Hospital patients will now have to access health care from other health authorities over long distances, using more ambulances for longer periods. Saving money from the downgrade of Louth Hospital will increase the costs on other peoples health services and the Ambulance Service. We ask the Health Secretary to find out how much extra money it will cost neighbouring health providers, and if they have budgeted for this increase in patients who would have previously attended Louth Hospital?

attributes.action: Stop HS2 Developers Demolishing the *Wet Woodland* area at Denham Country Park
attributes.background: Wet Woodland should be protected by law! The area is clearly wet woodland, but not being recognised as such. There are approximately 2000 different wild species in this area. Once these areas are gone, they are gone for good!!
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be No Net Loss of biodiversity in London. We and our future generations cannot afford to lose these areas which are important for air/water quality and for general mental wellbeing of those that use these spaces. 

The Mid-Colne Valley Site of Metropolitan Importance (SMI) for nature conservation is too important to be lost. Priority habitats and species must not be swept under the carpet.

Wet woodlands are UK most productive habitats equal to our rain forests there are not many left in London.

attributes.action: Create a Freedom of Speech Act and Bring an End to "Hate Speech" laws
attributes.background:
Who defines "Hate"

For several years now the government has been infringing people's' most basic rights to speak freely on matters, by deeming their speech "offensive" or "hateful" and declaring that such speech, even online, warrants being fined or jailed. This is an outrage!
attributes.additional_details:
We demand the legal right to Free Speech, in an Act which will bring an end to the ludicrous notion that "hate speech" and "offensive speech" deserves people be imprisoned or charged. In short, an Act to codify the citizens' right to freedom of speech without government intervention.

Ideas must be fought with other ideas, not with force. 


Naturally this precludes that the current laws criminalizing "hate speech" be rescinded.

attributes.action: Conduct a full enquiry into the finacial failure of NCC and those responsible
attributes.background:
Northamptonshire county council have completely failed in their financial responsibilities.
 We would like a full transparent public enquiry into the failings who is responsible and why and how this happened, so it can prevented in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
With planned cuts likely to affect the vulnerable, we think everyone involved should be held responsible and those affected have clear answers as to how this happened.
What messures are the government going to take to provide basic human rights to those most likely to be affected?

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin the E.U on March 29, 2019.
attributes.background: If the United Kingdom leaves the EU on March 29, 2019, we want to immediately apply to rejoin even if this means accepting conditions such as Schengen borders and the common (EURO) currency.
attributes.additional_details: #stopbrexit

attributes.action: Increase funding for multi-disciplinary treatment centres for FND Patients.
attributes.background: Funding is needed to set up and increase service provision for multi-disciplinary treatment centres. Treatment requires specialist care with a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Current options are limited & insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on Carers, Aids and Adaptations. They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ride a bike without a helmet.
attributes.background: In a majority of bicyclist deaths, the most serious injuries are to the head, highlighting the importance of wearing a bicycle helmet. 1 Helmet use has been estimated to reduce the odds of head injury by 50 percent, and the odds of head, face, or neck injury by 33 percent
attributes.additional_details:
What kids think on the subject. 
“Yes, it should be made the law because the only reason people don't wear helmets is because they would be made fun of. So if everyone wore one then no-one would be made fun of."

attributes.action: Do not ban the use and sale of E-Collars.
attributes.background: The government are calling for a ban on the use of "shock collars" more commonly known as E collars, branding them cruel. This is detrimental to many dogs, dog owners and rehabilators across the UK, and once the ban is implemented will follow with a rise in dog bites, rescues and deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
I can not stress enough the importance of not banning these tools, instead we should be sharing education on correct use. 
E-collars share many purposes: 
- A safety net for off lead sight hounds, hunting dogs and northern breeds well known for their lack of 're call. 
- To control security and protection trained dogs when off lead. 
- To control aggressive or reactive dogs who do not respond to positive only training methods. 
- Help protect live stock.

Please help responsible dog owners, and not prohibit the use of tools and training methods.

attributes.action: New independent complaints & monitoring body for schools & local authorities
attributes.background: Legislation and DfE guidance state how schools and local authorities must comply with the law. If statutory guidance or duties are not followed, enforcement is left to solo families using ineffective complaint procedures, or the LGO service, which won’t act in the face of ultra vires local policies.
attributes.additional_details: This problem often relates to SEN support, mental or physical illness provision, bullying, or disability discrimination. The lack of accountability in the system creates severe difficulties for families & denies many children the support & education they need. ‘Not Fine in School’ call for a new independent, transparent & objective body to enable a fair complaints process, which is NOT investigated by the complained of services. This body must be empowered to monitor practices & instigate consequences when schools or local authorities use local (invalid) policies, or act in an ultra vires way.

attributes.action: Stop the reduction of third year SFE maintenance loans for student nurses
attributes.background: Student nurses are now having to pay for tuition, whilst it is clear this is not going to be reversed anytime soon, this still remains a 45 week course per year, why, when the first set of self funded students reaches year 3 in September, will their maintenance loans be reduced?
attributes.additional_details: This needs to be sorted, we cannot afford to study in the third year with a reduced maintenance loan, especially considering we still have to attend placement over the summer and during traditional university/academic holidays.

attributes.action: A final say on the deal negotiated with the EU, with the option to Remain
attributes.background: Leave 'won' the Referendum, but voters have not had the opportuniy of seeing what the alternatives to our current membership of the EU are, and of deciding whether the likely economic, political and social consequences mean that it would be better for the UK to remain full members.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was 'won' on a simple majority because it was said to be Advisory at the time. There was at the time no indication of the type of deal, or relationship, the UK would achieve with the 27 other members of the EU. The government later said it would respect the will of the people: but the people may well have voted differently had they known the result would be considered set in stone (mandatory referendum would require a supermajority.)

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of animal products in public. Including meat, dairy and fur.
attributes.background:
There is substantial evidence of the serious links between the farming of animals and it's devastating effect on our environment. There is equally as strong evidence that the consumption of animal based diets is harmful to our health.
Animal agriculture for meat, dairy, eggs and clothing is cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Nations and World Health Organisation, as well as leading scientists and medical experts have and are continuing to evidence this as fact. 
Non human animals are sentient beings, they feel pain and emotion, as we do.
We must act for the planet, our health and the farmed and wild animals of the world, for a better future for all.
By continuing to advertise these products we are creating consumers and habits that are having negative impacts on all.

attributes.action: Give free child care to all 2 year olds
attributes.background: Why should only parents on certain benefits receive childcare? For fairness, all 2 year olds should receive free childcare, regardless of background.

attributes.action: Aesthetic medical treatments to only be performed by Doctors, Nurses & Dentists
attributes.background: Everyday we are hearing horror stories involving inexperienced and unqualified people administering medical treatments such as botox and derma fillers. There is an increasing need to regulate the aesthetic medical industry and provide awareness on the dangers.

attributes.action: Bring forward the implementation of 2% BIK for electric vehicles to April 2019
attributes.background: The government want to encourage the uptake of electric vehicles to help reduce CO2 and improve the environment.  Benefit in Kind for electric vehicles is due to fall to 2% in April 2020 which will help with this. However it is due to rise to 16% in April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: Currently electric vehicles, particularly those with longer ranges that may suit company car users better, typically have a higher purchase cost than petrol or diesel cars.  Company car users typically keep the same car for 3 years so those making decisions now are likely to avoid electric vehicles because of the increased BIK in 2019.  Bringing the 2% BIK forward to April 2019 would mean that the company car users would be much more likely to choose an Electric Vehicle now.

attributes.action: Increase statutory maternity pay to match other government pay amounts
attributes.background:
Becoming a parent can result in a significant reduction in income, causing many families to face cash flow problems. 

Many working parents are forced to return to work before a time which is best for their own mental health/the wellbeing of the child due to financial difficulties.
attributes.additional_details:
Statutory maternity pay is currently the lower of 90% of your weekly wage (pre-tax) or £145.18 per week. 
This is significantly lower than the state pension (£164.35 p/w)
This is lower than the benefits cap (£384.62 p/w).

Although becoming a parent is (for many) a choice, SMP is not sufficient to pay monthly bills and also provide for a child. This means many parents either delay or do not have children (and pregnancies are more high risk with older mothers), or are forced to return to work.

attributes.action: Parliament to ban sale of mist nets except to those with an appropriate licence.
attributes.background: Mist nets are being sold as anti bird netting online. These will trap birds which will die if not released, or be injured by untrained persons trying to release them. The nets cost from £1.44. At present it is not illegal to sell or own a mist net, but it is illegal to operate one without a licence.

attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship
